name: Robosumo
description:
Introduction

Sumo, but with robots! Ram your opponent and send them flying from the dohyō. Speed and finesse are your only weapons – but take care they're not turned against you!

Features
  • Old-school competitive play: Local multiplayer for up to four players.
  • Configurable game length: Play one round, or one-hundred!
  • Single-player practice mode: Hone your skills in a stress-free sandbox.
Scoring
  • 1-Player: Score is not kept in 1-Player mode.
  • 2-Player: Gain a point whenever the other player falls out of the ring.
  • 3- or 4-Player: Gain a point if you landed the last hit on the player who fell out of the ring. (It is possible for a round to conclude with no points scored.)
Controls Main Menu
  • UP/DOWN: Move cursor
  • LEFT/RIGHT: Toggle selected option
  • Z/X: Begin game
Game Screen Player 1
  • UP: Move robot forward
  • DOWN: Move robot backward
  • LEFT/RIGHT: Rotate robot
  • Z/X: Restart game (practice mode only)
Player 2
  • E: Move robot forward
  • D: Move robot backward
  • S/F: Rotate robot
Players 3 and 4

Joysticks or gamepads are required for 3- or 4-player games, as Pico-8 does not have native keyboard mappings for third- and fourth-player controllers.

  • UP: Move robot forward
  • DOWN: Move robot backward
  • LEFT/RIGHT: Rotate robot
Other Notes

Robosumo is free to play online. Offline copies are available for download below. The offline version is identical to the online version.

This is a completed game, but minor code optimizations and aesthetic updates may be released in the future.
